Hie British Consulate, MUSCAT. 16th Majr # 1930* d) l^Iy dear Sir Rupert, ffoen I saor the Saltan in Salalah I asked whether he would be prepared to extend the same courtesy ugaln as regards supplying a copy of the budget* Ae Sultan has replied that the Muscat Government are contemplating the publication of an Annual Administration Report, in which information about the budjet will be included, and this will be made available to His Majesty* s Government. Ke does not wish to continue to supply the budjet as formerly as this is reminiscent of loan days. Prom this it may be concluded that the Sultan will be very chary about accepting any loan for any enterprise, _f .lo means any tiind of financial supervision. Complete Independence is becoming a complex with the Sultan, it seems. Yours sincerely. H{ His Excellency Sir Rupert Hay, KCIS., CSI. Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. a^HRAIN.Aid* Wmoir* $ y ' His Highness the Sultan was kind anough to supply His Majesty's Consul in I94& In confidence with a copy of the Budget, which was of considerable interest to His Bxcellency the Political Resident* Would His Highness be prepared to extend the same courtesy again* It is a matter of the greatest assistance to Consuls and to various organisations in the United Kingdom to be able to consult Reports on the Administration of countries with which they hope to further their own country's trade.xtkkx Does the Muscat Government produce any such publication or if they contemplate doing so, could His Majesty's Consulate be supplied with some copies* Similarly any publication regarding development plans would be very helpful*

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file consists of a single letter and an aide-memoire.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of a single letter and what appears to be a draft copy of an aide-memoire. The letter, dated 16 May 1950 and addressed to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf by the Political Agent and Consul at Muscat, discusses the Sultan of Muscat and Oman's response to a request for a copy of his government's budget. The draft aide-memoire, addressed to the Sultan by the Political Agent, enquires about the possibility of obtaining copies of any existing government reports or publications regarding administration and development plans.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
